result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Yunk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow 
*1/2 of sentence to be completed on electronic home monitor if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration 
**If there would be any jail credit would be allowed on these cases but Court indicates defendant may have already been given credit for time served
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 1 on 15CM421

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Comply with the rules of any outstanding probation or extended supervision

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon L. Yunk in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM421, 16CM14 and 15TR2803.

8:35 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM421:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI 
Count 3 - No contest 

16CM14:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI 

15TR2803:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 3 of 15CM421 and Count 2 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 of 16CM14 and Count 2 is DRI and 15TR2803 is DRI .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant will begin ATR on March 14, 2016 and will be on probation once ATR is  completed.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM421:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 40 day jail sentence consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving 
Placed on Probation for 24 months Concurrent
If probation revoked - Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
1/2 of sentence to be completed on electronic home monitor of approved by the risk assessment and administration
***Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs/surcharges - DNA surcharge
*Provide DNA sample if not already done
*Comply with the rules of any outstanding probation or extended supervison

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
*Pay fine of $200 plus costs/surcharges 
*zero days jail
*zero day revocation

16CM14:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 180 day jail sentence to run consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving 
Placed on Probation for 24 months to run concurrent with 15CM421 Count 1
If probation revoked - Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
1/2 of sentence to be completed on electronic home monitor of approved by the risk assessment and jail administration
***Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs/surcharges - DNA Surcharge
*Comply with the rules of any outstanding probation or extended supervison
**If any jail credit would be allowed on these cases but may have already been given credit

Count 2 - DRI

15TR2803:
Count 1 - DRI

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon L. Yunk appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting/Obstructing an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  1/25/16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Defendant makes statements.  Requests a signature bond. 
BY THE COURT:  Court will not order a signature bond.  
Defendant asks for $300 cash bond.  
BY THE COURT:  Denied. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
